website_summaries.verdict: Dell's G3 15 gaming laptop doesn't stand out on design, but delivers good value for the money with reliable performance and plenty of storage.
pros: Good-value component mix for the money
GTX 1050 Ti powers competent HD gaming
Test config has an SSD and a roomy hard drive

customer_reviews.title: Maybe one of the best laptops in this price range!
customer_reviews.text: I searched far and wide to find the perfect 800£ laptop, and after three sleepless nights of scouring the internet, i decided that this one with just a little help from a second 8gig RAM plate would be an incredible machine until i save some money on something a bit more...desktopy. It could also suit a girl's needs (basically it's not bulky is what i'm trying to say) it has an amazing slim design, matte colors...it's just pretty! The specs are really good, you cannot get any better than that for that price. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Fast AND reliable. But get an external drive for file storage
customer_reviews.text: The steady state disk rather than the older type hard drive makes a huge difference. I edit graphic, audio and video files and the faster disk makes a real difference. At 250gb the disk isn't massive. I use an external hard drive to store files I'm not currently using. I may add another card of RAM. But this isn't difficult. No problems at all and I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. N. A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good performance but touchpad didn't work
customer_reviews.text: This laptop has a fast cpu and the ssd allows you to open files and boot up quickly. From my research it can run most modern (2016 -2018) games at around 45 fps on low settings so I would describe it (the gtx 1050 4gb version) as an entry level gaming PC. Unfortunately, when I bought it the touchpad was not working so I returned it to amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: stephen231

customer_reviews.title: don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at Christmas but it would keep braking down, it would blue screen all the time and the start up menu and cortans wouldn't work, I had to restart it about three four times, wouldnt spend that amount amount of monney on it
customer_reviews.author: Loui

customer_reviews.title: Good entry gaming laptop, screen is mildly mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Really good entry gaming laptop. Responsive keyboard and fairly good battery life. Screen is mildly mediocre but still good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shanks

customer_reviews.title: The screen freezes on a regular basis and needs to be restarted regularly.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy with this laptop at all. It keep crashing on a regular basis. The screen freezes with and can only be rescued by restarting. This is very frustrating because I bought it a work laptop. I am looking into returning the laptop and asking for a refund. I have not had this sort of problem with previous Dell laptops, I am surprised and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Forever DENTAL and SKIN

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Has overheated at the back whilst using which has bent the screen bracket and now unable to close the screen on the laptop without it breaking. Have got less than 6 months use out of an expensive laptop
customer_reviews.author: Mr Stephen A Barber

customer_reviews.title: Its a good value for its money
customer_reviews.text: Had i everything i wanted for i budget laptop but the battery life dissapointed me
customer_reviews.author: Nikolaos

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a laptop to meet my gaming needs and didnt want to splash too much cash. A lovely sleek design with a powerful motor behind it! Upgraded my 5 year old laptop to this and I’m very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Darth Simon

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for entry level 60FPS gamers
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop for all your AAA games. Plays at a steady 60+ FPS on medium to high settings. Totally recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: LtAlex

customer_reviews.title: SCAM
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived with no HDD. The speakers were also blown out. Scam, do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: FST

customer_reviews.title: No quality control
customer_reviews.text: Laptop failed at the second click on initial set up. Clearly no quality control. Would no recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop for Gaming & everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop a couple of weeks ago now. From my understanding this is part of Dell's new "gaming" range, where the gaming systems are classified by G3 and G5. The laptop is good looking, light for a gaming device, and very quick. I have been using it for "everyday jobs" and my son uses it for occasional gaming. I would recommend this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: jon

product_meta.title: Dell G3 15 3000 15.6 Inch FHD Gaming Laptop (Black) Intel Core i5-8300H Processor, 8 GB RAM, 256 GB SSD, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 with 4 GB GDDR5 Graphics, Windows 10 Home
product_meta.description:
Processor: 8th Generation Intel Core i5-8300H processor (quad-core, 8 MB cache, up to 3.9 GHz with turbo boost

Operating system: Windows 10 Home 64-bit English

Memory: 8 GB, DDR4, 2666 MHz; up to 32 GB (additional memory sold separately) 

Video graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 with 4 GB GDDR5 graphics memory

Hard drive: 256 GB solid state drive

Multimedia drive: No optical drive

Media card reader: SD card reader and USB 3.1, 2.0

Fingerprint reader: Yes

Bluetooth: Bluetooth tied to wireless card

Display: 15.6 Inch FHD (1920 x 1080) IPS anti-glare LED-backlit display

Wireless connectivity: 802.11ac + Bluetooth 5.0, dual band 2.4 and 5 GHz, MU-MIMO/80 MHz, 1 x 1

Audio: MaxxAudio Pro(Windows), stereo speakers (Windows) 

Keyboard: Internal UK/Irish qwerty backlit keyboard

Webcam: Yes

Battery: 56 Whr, 4-cell battery (integrated) 

Warranty and support: Retail standard service - 15 months collect and return, 10 days

McAfee 30 day trial

Microsoft Office 2013 trial



BOX CONTAINS
System, Power Supply, Power Cable, Documentation
feature_bullets: Slim and sleek: At just 22.7 mm thickness for the 15 Inch, the slim line design makes it even easier to game on the go
Graphically high: Powerful NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Series discrete graphics for a smooth immersive on-screen experience
Built for speed with 256 GB SSD including NVMe PCIe to ensure faster performance and better reliability
More power; better gameplay; Intel 8th Generation processors provide responsive, powerful gaming and multi-tasking performance

specifications.Graphics Card Description: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 with 4GB GDDR5 graphics memory
